intro: Blepharis cuanzensis var. cuanzensis, commonly known as the African grassvetch, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and savannas. Its flowers are usually pale blue or violet, and it produces small, three-lobed seeds. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
